label: 獅子
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 56th  . Nara National Museum . 2004
説明文: An auspicious mythical beast often referred to as a Chinese lion (karajishi), this motif originated in western Asia and entered China during the Sui dynasty (581-618) through Sassania. A popular decorative motif in Japan from the 7th century on, shishi figures can be found on mirror backs and in textile designs. [唐獅子]
